SEARCH
Package org.domain.controllers

Class ControllerDomain

java.lang.Object
org.domain.controllers.ControllerDomain
public class ControllerDomain extends Object
ControllerDomain Manages the main operations of the application, including handling products, product lists, shelves, and data file processing. Coordinates with ProductManager and DataParser classes to operate on the catalog and product lists.
Version:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • ControllerDomain

      public ControllerDomain()
      Constructs a new ControllerDomain instance and initializes its components.

      This constructor initializes various managers and components used by the ControllerDomain class, including the shelf map, product manager, similarity manager, input manager, distribution manager, persistence controller, user manager, and operation log. It also loads user credentials and configuration files as part of the initialization process.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ControllerDomain getInstance()
      Returns the single instance of the ControllerDomain class.

      This method utilizes the Singleton design pattern to ensure that only one instance of the ControllerDomain is created and provides a global point of access to it.

      Returns:
      the single instance of ControllerDomain

    • loginUser

      public void loginUser(String userInput, String password) throws UnauthorizedAccessException
      Logs in a user into the system. Validates the user's credentials and loads the associated data, including product lists and distributions.
      Parameters:
      userInput - the username or identifier provided by the user.
      password - the corresponding password for the user.
      Throws:
      UnauthorizedAccessException - if the provided credentials are invalid.

    • logoutUser

      public void logoutUser() throws UserException
      Logs out the currently active user from the system. Saves the user's data before logging out, clears user-related data from the system memory, and records the operation in the log.

      This method performs the following steps to log out a user:

      1. Retrieves the active username from the UserManager.
      2. Calls the logoutUser method of the UserManager to log out the user.
      3. If the logout is successful:
        1. Saves the user's product lists to the persistence layer using the ControllerPersistence.
        2. Clears the product lists from the ProductManager.
        3. Clears the shelf map, removing all shelves from the system.
        4. Removes the user's data from the UserManager.
        5. Logs the logout operation in the operation log.
      Throws:
      UserException - if an issue occurs during the logout process.

    • registerUser

      public void registerUser(String username, String email, String password) throws UnauthorizedAccessException, UserException
      Registers a new user in the system.

      This method performs the following steps to register a new user:

      1. Calls the registerUser method of the UserManager to register the user with the provided username, email, and password.
      2. Calls the registerUser method of the ControllerPersistence to persist the user data.
      3. Logs the registration operation in the operation log.

      If the registration is successful, the user is added to the system and their credentials are stored in the persistence layer.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the new user
      email - the email address of the new user
      password - the password for the new user
      Throws:
      UnauthorizedAccessException - if the user does not have permission to register
      UserException - if there is an error during the registration process

    • addProductToCatalog

      public void addProductToCatalog(String productName, String category, double price, int amount, ArrayList<Pair<String,Double>> similarities) throws ProductException
      Adds a new product to the catalog with the specified details.

      This method adds a product to the catalog by passing the provided product information to the product manager. It trims the product name and processes the category, price, amount, and similar products as part of the addition.

      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product to be added
      category - the category under which the product falls
      price - the price of the product
      amount - the quantity of the product
      similarities - a pair<productName, similarity>
      Throws:
      ProductException - if any parameter is invalid

    • removeProductFromCatalog

      public void removeProductFromCatalog(String productName) throws ProductException
      Removes a product from the catalog by its name.

      This method removes the specified product from the catalog by invoking the product manager's method to handle the removal process.

      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product to be removed from the catalog
      Throws:
      ProductException - if there is an error while removing the product from the catalog

    • updateProduct

      public void updateProduct(String name, String category, double price, int amount, ArrayList<Pair<String,Double>> similarities) throws ProductException
      Brief: Updates a product in the catalog.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the product
      category - the category of the product
      price - the price of the product
      amount - the quantity of the product
      similarities - a list of pairs with the name of the product and the similarity value
      Throws:
      ProductException - if the product name is invalid

    • createProductList

      public void createProductList(String listName, String category) throws ProductListException
      Brief: Creates a new product list with a specified category.
      Parameters:
      listName - the name of the product list
      category - the category of products in the list
      Throws:
      ProductListException - if the list name is invalid

    • addProductToList

      public void addProductToList(String productName, String listName) throws ProductException, ProductListException
      Adds a product to a specified list.

      This method adds a product to a product list identified by the list name. The product is added by passing the product name and the list name to the product manager.

      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product to be added to the list
      listName - the name of the list to which the product will be added
      Throws:
      ProductException - if there is an error while adding the product to the list
      ProductListException - if there is an issue with the specified product list

    • removeProductFromList

      public void removeProductFromList(String productName, String listName) throws ProductException, ProductListException
      Brief: Removes a product from a specific list.
      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product
      listName - the name of the product list
      Throws:
      ProductException - if the product name is invalid
      ProductListException - if the list name is invalid

    • removeProductsFromList

      public void removeProductsFromList(String listName, Set<String> productNames) throws ProductException, ProductListException
      Brief: Removes a set of products from a specific list.
      Parameters:
      listName - the name of the product list
      productNames - the set of product names
      Throws:
      ProductException - if the product name is invalid
      ProductListException - if the list name is invalid

    • showSimilarity

      public String showSimilarity()
      Displays the similarities of products in the catalog.

      This method retrieves and returns a string representation of the similarities between products, as managed by the product manager.

      Returns:
      a string containing the product similarities

    • setSimilarity

      public void setSimilarity(String productName1, String productName2, double similarity) throws ProductException
      Adds a similarity relationship between two products.

      This method establishes a similarity relationship between two products identified by their names and assigns a similarity score. It retrieves the products and passes them along with the similarity score to the product manager for processing.

      Parameters:
      productName1 - the name of the first product
      productName2 - the name of the second product
      similarity - the similarity score between the two products
      Throws:
      ProductException - if there is an error while adding the similarity between the products

    • removeProductList

      public void removeProductList(String listName) throws ProductListException, ShelfException
      Removes a product list from the catalog.

      This method attempts to remove a product list identified by the provided list name. Before removing, it checks if any shelf is associated with the list. If a shelf is found with the associated product list, an exception is thrown to prevent the removal.

      Parameters:
      listName - the name of the product list to be removed
      Throws:
      ProductListException - if there is an error while removing the product list
      ShelfException - if a shelf is associated with the product list and prevents its removal

    • decreaseProductQuantity

      public void decreaseProductQuantity(String productName, int quantity) throws ProductException
      Decreases the quantity of a specified product in the catalog.

      This method decreases the available quantity of a product identified by its name. It delegates the task to the product manager to handle the quantity reduction.

      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product whose quantity is to be decreased
      quantity - the amount by which the product's quantity will be reduced
      Throws:
      ProductException - if there is an error while decreasing the product's quantity

    • increaseProductQuantity

      public void increaseProductQuantity(String productName, int quantity) throws ProductException
      Increases the quantity of a specified product in the catalog.

      This method increases the available quantity of a product identified by its name. It delegates the task to the product manager to handle the quantity increase.

      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product whose quantity is to be increased
      quantity - the amount by which the product's quantity will be increased
      Throws:
      ProductException - if there is an error while increasing the product's quantity

    • showProductList

      public String showProductList(String listName) throws ProductListException
      Retrieves and returns a string representation of a product list by its name.
      Parameters:
      listName - the name of the product list to retrieve
      Returns:
      a string representation of the product list
      Throws:
      ProductListException - if the specified list cannot be found or an error occurs while retrieving it

    • applyDiscountToList

      public void applyDiscountToList(String listName, double percentage) throws ProductListException
      Applies a discount to all products in a specified product list.

      This method applies a discount, specified by the percentage, to all products within the given product list. The operation is delegated to the product manager for processing.

      Parameters:
      listName - the name of the product list to which the discount will be applied
      percentage - the discount percentage to be applied to the products in the list
      Throws:
      ProductListException - if there is an error while applying the discount to the product list

    • createShelf

      public void createShelf(int id, int xcapacity, int ycapacity, String listName, int algorithm) throws ShelfException, ProductListException
      Creates a new shelf with the specified capacity, product list, and algorithm.

      This method creates a shelf with a given ID, x and y capacity, and associates it with a product list and an algorithm for shelf arrangement. The algorithm can either be a brute force or hill climbing method. It also performs various validations to ensure the shelf's parameters are correct and that the product list can fit on the shelf.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier for the shelf
      xcapacity - the x-axis capacity (width) of the shelf
      ycapacity - the y-axis capacity (height) of the shelf
      listName - the name of the product list to be associated with the shelf
      algorithm - the algorithm to be used for product arrangement (1 for BruteForce, 2 for HillClimbing)
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the shelf ID already exists, or if there is an invalid algorithm, or invalid shelf capacity
      ProductListException - if the product list is empty, or if the product list cannot fit on the shelf due to its size

    • changeProductListAtShelf

      public void changeProductListAtShelf(int idShelf, String listName) throws ProductListException, ShelfException
      Changes the product list associated with a specified shelf.

      This method replaces the current product list on a shelf with a new product list. It first checks if the shelf exists and if the new product list can fit within the shelf's capacity. If the conditions are met, the product list on the shelf is updated.

      Parameters:
      idShelf - the ID of the shelf whose product list is to be changed
      listName - the name of the new product list to be assigned to the shelf
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the shelf with the specified ID does not exist
      ProductListException - if the new product list exceeds the shelf's capacity

    • changeShelfAlgorithm

      public void changeShelfAlgorithm(int id, int algorithm) throws ShelfException
      Changes the algorithm used for product arrangement on a specified shelf.

      This method updates the algorithm used for arranging products on a shelf, either to Brute Force or Hill Climbing, based on the provided algorithm identifier. It first validates the shelf ID and the algorithm type before applying the change.

      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the shelf whose algorithm is to be changed
      algorithm - the identifier of the algorithm to be applied (1 for Brute Force, 2 for Hill Climbing)
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the shelf with the specified ID does not exist or if the algorithm identifier is invalid

    • createNewDistributionFile

      public void createNewDistributionFile(String fileName, String path, int idShelf) throws ShelfException, DistributionException, IOException
      Creates a new distribution file for a specified shelf.

      This method generates a distribution file based on the last distribution of the specified shelf. It saves the file to the given path with the provided file name. If no path is provided, it defaults to the current directory.

      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to store the distribution
      path - the directory path where the file will be saved (defaults to current directory if empty)
      idShelf - the ID of the shelf for which the distribution file will be created
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the specified shelf does not exist
      DistributionException - if there is an error while storing the distribution data
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file

    • getDataThroughFile

      public void getDataThroughFile(String filePath) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Processes data from a file located at the specified file path.

      This method reads and processes data from the file at the provided file path. It delegates the task to the input manager to handle the file parsing. The file path is trimmed before being passed to the input manager.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file containing the data to be processed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file path is invalid or if the file cannot be processed

    • showAllShelves

      public String showAllShelves()
      Retrieves a string representation of all the shelves in the system.

      This method iterates through all the shelves stored in the shelfMap and appends their string representations to a single StringBuilder, which is then converted to a string and returned.

      Returns:
      A string containing the details of all shelves.

    • showShelf

      public String showShelf(int idShelf) throws ShelfException
      Retrieves a string representation of a specific shelf identified by its ID.

      If the shelf with the specified ID does not exist, a ShelfException is thrown. Otherwise, the string representation of the shelf is returned.

      Parameters:
      idShelf - The ID of the shelf to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A string containing the details of the specified shelf.
      Throws:
      ShelfException - If no shelf with the specified ID exists.

    • showAllLists

      public String showAllLists()
      Retrieves a string representation of all product lists in the system.

      This method iterates through all the product lists managed by the productManager and appends their string representations to a StringBuilder. The resulting string contains the details of all product lists in the system.

      Returns:
      A string containing the details of all product lists.

    • getProductsFromCatalog

      public TupleType getProductsFromCatalog() throws ProductException
      Retrieves the products in the catalog as a TupleType object.

      This method retrieves all products from the productManager and constructs a TupleType containing the name, category, price, amount, and similarities of each product. The resulting TupleType is returned.

      Returns:
      A TupleType containing the products in the catalog.
      Throws:
      ProductException - If there is an error while retrieving the products.

    • getProductByName

      public TupleType getProductByName(String productName) throws ProductException
      Retrieves the products in the catalog as a Set of TupleType objects.

      This method retrieves all products from the productManager and constructs a TupleType containing the name, category, and price of each product. The resulting TupleType is returned.

      Parameters:
      productName - The name of the product to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A Set of TupleType objects containing the products in the catalog.
      Throws:
      ProductException - If there is an error while retrieving the products.

    • getAllLists

      public Set<TupleType> getAllLists() throws ProductListException
      Retrieves all product lists and their associated products as a set of TupleType objects.

      This method first checks if there are any product lists in the system by querying the productManager. If no product lists exist, it throws a ProductListException. For each product list, it constructs a TupleType containing the list's name, category, last modification date, and a nested TupleType representing the products in the list. Each product is represented by its name, category, price, original price, and quantity.

      Returns:
      A Set of TupleType objects, where each represents a product list along with its associated products.
      Throws:
      ProductListException - If no product lists exist in the system.

    • getList

      public TupleType getList(String nameList) throws ProductListException, ProductException
      Brief: Retrieves a product list by name.
      Parameters:
      nameList - the name of the product list
      Returns:
      the product list
      Throws:
      ProductListException - if the list name is invalid
      ProductException - if there is an error while retrieving similarities in the products

    • getAllDistributionsNames

      public Set<String> getAllDistributionsNames(int idShelf) throws ShelfException, DistributionException
      Retrieves the names of all distributions associated with a specific shelf.

      This method checks if a shelf with the given ID exists in the shelfMap. If the shelf exists, it retrieves the names of all distributions associated with that shelf. If the shelf does not exist, a ShelfException is thrown. If no distributions are found for the shelf, a DistributionException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      idShelf - The ID of the shelf whose distribution names are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A Set of strings containing the names of all distributions for the specified shelf.
      Throws:
      ShelfException - If the shelf with the specified ID does not exist.
      DistributionException - If there are no distributions associated with the shelf.

    • getDistributionInfo

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> getDistributionInfo(int idSelf, String nameDist) throws DistributionException, ShelfException
      Retrieves the distribution information for a given shelf and distribution name. This method checks if the specified shelf exists and then delegates the retrieval of the distribution to the shelf.
      Parameters:
      idSelf - the identifier of the shelf to retrieve the distribution from.
      nameDist - the name of the distribution to retrieve.
      Returns:
      a nested list of strings representing the product names in the specified distribution.
      Throws:
      DistributionException - if the distribution with the specified name is not found in the shelf.
      ShelfException - if the shelf with the specified ID does not exist.

    • getShelf

      public TupleType getShelf(int id) throws ShelfException
      Retrieves the details of a specific shelf identified by its ID.

      This method searches for the shelf with the given ID in the shelfMap. If the shelf exists, it retrieves the shelf's ID, maximum capacity, algorithm name, and list name, and returns them as a TupleType. If the shelf does not exist, a ShelfException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the shelf to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A TupleType containing the ID, maximum capacity, algorithm name, and list name of the shelf.
      Throws:
      ShelfException - If no shelf with the specified ID exists.

    • getAllShelves

      public Set<TupleType> getAllShelves() throws ShelfException
      Retrieves all shelves in the system as a set of TupleType objects.

      This method iterates through the shelves stored in the shelfMap and creates a TupleType for each shelf containing the shelf's ID, maximum capacity, algorithm name, and list name. It adds each TupleType to a Set and returns the set containing all the shelves. If there are no shelves in the system, a ShelfException is thrown.

      Returns:
      A Set of TupleType objects representing all shelves in the system.
      Throws:
      ShelfException - If no shelves exist in the system.

    • getDistributionsShelf

      public Set<TupleType> getDistributionsShelf(int id) throws ShelfException
      Retrieves the distribution log for a specific shelf identified by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the shelf whose distribution log is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      a Set of TupleType objects representing the distributions stored in the specified shelf.
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the shelf with the given ID does not exist in the shelfMap.

    • getAllProductsCatalog

      public ArrayList<Product> getAllProductsCatalog()
      Retrieves all products in the catalog.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of all products

    • deleteShelf

      public void deleteShelf(int id) throws ShelfException
      Deletes a shelf from the shelf map by its ID. This method removes the shelf with the specified ID from the internal mapping of shelves. If the ID does not exist in the map, the method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the shelf to be removed
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the shelf with the given ID does not exist

    • createNewDistribution

      public void createNewDistribution(int idShelf, String nameDistribution, int limit) throws ShelfException, DistributionException
      Creates a new distribution for a specified shelf.

      This method creates a distribution for the given shelf based on the provided distribution name and depth limit. It validates that the shelf exists and that the depth limit is greater than zero. The distribution is then applied, and the new distribution is added to the distribution manager.

      Parameters:
      idShelf - the ID of the shelf for which the distribution will be created
      nameDistribution - the name of the new distribution
      limit - the depth limit for the distribution (must be greater than 0)
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the specified shelf does not exist
      DistributionException - if the depth limit is invalid (i.e., zero or negative)

    • makeCurrentDistributionShelf

      public void makeCurrentDistributionShelf(int idShelf, String nameDistribution) throws ShelfException, DistributionException
      Marks a specified distribution as the current distribution for a given shelf.

      This method checks if the shelf with the provided ID exists in the system. If the shelf exists, it retrieves the corresponding Shelf object and a Distribution object identified by its name. The method then updates the shelf to mark the specified distribution as the current one using the makeCurrentDistribution method of the Shelf class.

      Parameters:
      idShelf - the unique identifier of the shelf.
      nameDistribution - the name of the distribution to be set as current.
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the shelf with the given ID does not exist in the system.
      DistributionException - if the distribution with the given name does not exist or cannot be marked as current.

    • showLasDistributionShelf

      public String showLasDistributionShelf(int idShelf) throws ShelfException
      Displays the details of the last distribution for a specified shelf.

      This method retrieves and returns the details of the most recent distribution applied to the shelf identified by the given shelf ID. If the shelf does not exist, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      idShelf - the ID of the shelf whose last distribution details are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      a string representation of the last distribution for the specified shelf
      Throws:
      ShelfException - if the specified shelf does not exist

    • showShelfs

      public String showShelfs()
      Brief: Muestra todos los estantes disponibles en el sistema. Este método construye y devuelve una representación en cadena de todos los estantes registrados en el sistema, iterando a través del mapa de estantes y concatenando sus representaciones en cadena.
      Returns:
      Una cadena que contiene la información de todos los estantes.

    • modifyDistribution

      public void modifyDistribution(String nameDistribution, String nameProduct1, String nameProduct2) throws DistributionException
      Modifies a distribution by updating the relationship between two specified products.

      This method modifies the specified distribution by adjusting the relationship between two products based on their names. The modification is handled by the distribution manager.

      Parameters:
      nameDistribution - the name of the distribution to be modified
      nameProduct1 - the name of the first product involved in the modification
      nameProduct2 - the name of the second product involved in the modification
      Throws:
      DistributionException - if there is an error while modifying the distribution

    • showOperationLog

      public String showOperationLog()
      Retrieves the operation log as a string.

      This method iterates through the operation log entries and constructs a string representation of each entry, including the date and description of the operation. The resulting string contains all the logged operations in the system.

      Returns:
      A string containing the operation log entries.

    • getOperationLog

      public TupleType getOperationLog()
      Retrieves the operation log as a TupleType.
      Returns:
      a TupleType containing the operation log entries.
